titleStmt.title: Letter from Daniel Frohman to Samuel L. Clemens: an electronic text

p.bibl: The Mark Twain Papers, The Bancroft Library, University of California, Berkeley (CU-MARK).

body.head: Daniel Frohman to Samuel L. Clemens 31 March 1884 • New York, N.Y. (MS: CU-MARK, UCLC 41870)

div1.p: I have seldom encroached upon your good nature. I have never asked you even to write me a play, much as I should like to see you come to the front in that respect.
But I do ask you to consider whether you can submit me your autograph. We will dramatize it and adapt it to the stage

closer.signed: Danl. FrohmanOnly two years later he took up Frohman's offer to do a play: in 1886 Frohman produced the stage version of Colonel Sellers (based on the Gilded Age). In 1890 he would put on Abby Sage Richardson's adaptation of the The Prince and the Pauper, which caused Clemens to file suit (an event that apparently did not harm their relationship significantly). In 1907 he and Clemens worked together to put on a children's production of The Prince and the Pauper.
